title: Quiz 7: Comprehensive Review
description: A final comprehensive review covering Facilitative Supervision, Mentoring, Coaching, Counseling, and Conflict Resolution.

questions.question: Match the concept to its primary definition:

pairs.right: Informal transmission of knowledge & social capital
Training approach for continuous improvement in performance
Helping an individual understand problems & find solutions
Guiding & monitoring to promote compliance & quality

questions.explanation: Mentoring=Knowledge/Social; Coaching=Performance Improvement; Counseling=Problem Solving; Supervision=Quality/Compliance.
questions.hint: Differentiate between performance, personal problems, and quality assurance.

questions.question: Which model involves the stages of Exploration, Challenging, and Action Planning?
questions.explanation: Egan's Model of counseling consists of Exploration, Challenging, and Action Planning.

questions.question: In conflict resolution, one must 'Seek to understand all ___BLANK___ of the issue'.
questions.explanation: Step 3 of conflict resolution is 'Seek to understand all sides of the issue'.
questions.hint: There are usually two of these to every story.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of Mentoring? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Mentoring improves productivity, retention, and knowledge linking. It breaks down silos (not creates them).

questions.question: Order the stages of the Coaching process:
questions.explanation: Rapport -> Direction -> Core -> Winding up -> Moving on.

questions.question: Traditional supervision is considerate and protects self-esteem.
questions.explanation: False. Traditional supervision is often inconsiderate, harsh, and sarcastic. Facilitative supervision protects self-esteem.

questions.question: Review the scenario below. Which skill is the supervisor applying?

richContent.content: Scenario: A supervisor sits with a CHV who is struggling with reporting. The supervisor leans forward, maintains eye contact, nods while the CHV explains their difficulty, and does not interrupt.

questions.explanation: The supervisor is demonstrating SOLER (Attending) and Active Listening skills.

questions.question: What is the acronym used for Attending Skills in counseling?
Which of the following are differences between Coaching and Mentoring? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Coaching is usually finite; Mentoring can be longer term
Coaching focuses on current job; Mentoring focuses on career
Coaching is informal; Mentoring is always formal
Coaching is relationship-driven; Mentoring is performance-driven only

questions.explanation: Coaching is finite/job-focused. Mentoring is career-focused/relationship-driven.

questions.question: Conflict resolution benefits include better results and group harmony.
questions.explanation: True. Benefits include better results, group harmony, stress management, and knowledge management.
questions.hint: Does solving problems help the group?
